intro: Centaurea banatica, commonly known as the Banat’s centaury, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers, typical of the genus Centaurea. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
